definition: ode/eulogy/to praise in writing/to wish (in letters)

sentences.english: Beginning to extol the black oblation;
The dominant idea was to be the glorification of horticulture and the exaltation of agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 其主題是對園藝的讚頌，以及對農藝感到興奮。

sentences.english: They praised God for their safe deliverance from the difficult position.
sentences.chinese: 他們讚頌上帝使他們從困境中安全脫險。

sentences.english: And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly army, praising God, and saying.
sentences.chinese: 忽有一大隊天軍，同那天使一起讚頌天主說。

sentences.english: His description of Gatsby's extravagant parties are closer to satire than eulogy.
sentences.chinese: 他對蓋茨比豪宴的描述與其說是讚頌不如說是諷刺。

sentences.english: Jealousy is the tribute mediocrity pays to achievers.
sentences.chinese: 嫉妒是平庸之輩向成就卓越者的讚頌。

sentences.english: Praise be to Allah, the Cherisher and Sustainer of the worlds;
sentences.chinese: 一切讚頌全歸真主，衆世界的主。

sentences.english: Upon request from disciple Detong Dakini I had recited the praises for lunar 15 once more.
sentences.chinese: 應弟子茶桶空行之提請，我已再錄一回十五的讚頌集。

sentences.english: The Chinese nation is praised for its important invention by the historians of science and technology the world over.
sentences.chinese: 中華民族這一重大發明爲世界科技史家所讚頌。

sentences.english: One of the key ideas in Isaiah 2 is that of exalting or lifting up.
sentences.chinese: 以賽亞書2章特點之一就是讚頌和提升。

sentences.english: It praises the brave Chinese people and the land they live.
sentences.chinese: 它讚頌了英勇的中國人民和他們生活的土地。

sentences.english: The second objection is, that hehas praised Bayle, in calling him a great man.
sentences.chinese: 第二個異議時，他讚頌培爾，稱他是個偉大的人物。

sentences.english: Disciples Detong and Zhi Xuan requested me to do calligraphy for the attached praises by disciples.
sentences.chinese: 弟子茶桶和智宣都要求我書寫附呈由弟子所寫的讚頌。

sentences.english: Praise be to God, the Cherisher and Sustainer of the worlds;
sentences.chinese: 一切讚頌全歸真主，衆世界的主。

sentences.english: Praise be to Allah, Lord of the Worlds.
sentences.chinese: 一切讚頌，全歸真主，全世界的主。

definition: to pass on the light of Buddha
after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
